intro: Hiraea reitzii, commonly known as the Reitz's hiraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in the spring. Hiraea reitzii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
